title: NSF Serves on Windows 10 seems missing: `C:\tools\rclone.exe --config rclone.conf serve nfs --addr localhost:2049 dst:` fails
body:
The NFS is not listed as a serve type:

Rclone version 1.69.0

```
C:\Users\niteris\dev\rclone-api>rclone --version
rclone v1.69.0
- os/version: Microsoft Windows 10 Pro 22H2 22H2 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 10.0.19045.5371 (x86_64)
- os/type: windows
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.23.4
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: cmount
```

*Rclone output when I run this command*

```
C:\Users\niteris\dev\rclone-api>C:\tools\rclone.exe --config rclone.conf serve nfs --addr localhost:2049 dst:
Error: unknown flag: --addr
Usage:
  rclone serve <protocol> [opts] <remote> [flags]
  rclone serve [command]

Available commands:
  dlna        Serve remote:path over DLNA
  docker      Serve any remote on docker's volume plugin API.
  ftp         Serve remote:path over FTP.
  http        Serve the remote over HTTP.
  restic      Serve the remote for restic's REST API.
  s3          Serve remote:path over s3.
  sftp        Serve the remote over SFTP.
  webdav      Serve remote:path over WebDAV.

Flags:
  -h, --help   help for serve

Use "rclone [command] --help" for more information about a command.
Use "rclone help flags" for to see the global flags.
Use "rclone help backends" for a list of supported services.

2025/01/30 12:14:44 NOTICE: Fatal error: unknown flag: --addr
```
